2ACE703B3A9A44A6B30504E7BBA1A26E.description:

human, and capital resources by

F28901DA967F4B13B13C11F8F605E260.description:
explaining how cartography is used to reflect regional perspectives, point of view, and
perceptions of an area and the creation of mental maps.

E4CE0528305B481D9C683D2718942F25.description:
analyzing how cultural characteristics, including the world’s major languages, ethnicities,
and religions, link or divide regions; and

425926D6BE8944F18594038779C4F4CC.description:
describing how regional landscapes reflect the physical environment and the cultural
characteristics of their inhabitants;

119D2E3C1AB240AEB514E500F22E3FAA.description: explaining how characteristics of regions have led to regional labels;

CBE1269896FB41EB8DD9F9143F336077.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to explain how geographic information
and geospatial tools are used to make decisions by

F4562DB5EDBE4394B46E99B85958B0F4.description:
contextualizing, corroborating, and evaluating sources for credibility, propaganda, and bias
to determine patterns and trends to understand the world.

7FD4061040F348C8B58C91F1DD2D7348.description:
developing products that reflect an understanding of research, content, and world
geography concepts; and

37F2064D2E0C47ED81051A36A8B113DB.description:
engaging and communicating as a civil and informed individual with persons with different
perspectives;

73E306FD2A5C48A5BED729D69B35D8F1.description:
using economic decision-making models to analyze and explain the incentives for and
consequences of a specific choice;

2BF105BDE6AF44759666AA91D6530B63.description: comparing and contrasting historical, cultural, economic, and political perspectives;

334FC25A4433445790C00AB6EB130837.description: investigating and analyzing evidence from multiple sources to construct arguments;

6200FDFA39264FC2917B34AB7508558E.description: developing questions, enhancing curiosity, and engaging in critical thinking and analysis;

69EA92CE1984433AA9E491AC52D490D5.description:
applying geographic skills to determine and predict patterns and movement of people,
places, and events;

61934E81A3494ED9B12E41E9A8A25C64.description:
selecting and synthesizing evidence from information sources, including, but not limited to
artifacts, primary and secondary sources, charts, graphs, diagrams, and geospatial
technologies, including maps, GIS, and GPS imagery, to understand the regions of the
world;

4FD94F4D8C4C4CF68C2A455AD49DB29B.description:
The student will demonstrate skills for historical thinking, geographical analysis,
economic decision making, and responsible citizenship by
